result.execSummary:
The defendant William Kendall Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Kendall Adams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Kendall Adams was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:58  Defendant William Kendall Adams in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko who appears by video conf from Fairbault MN DOC facility. Defendant William Adams is in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 of the information .  Count 2 is dismissed.   Court orders S/W Probation 2 years conc with sentence  currently serving at the MN Correctional Facility and any probation or extended supervision that will be placed on him in MN. Cond Court costs. Comply with any conditions the agents impose. DNA Sample and surcharge.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-19-2015 11:45 am.

10:12 Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: based on non appearance of Def requests a bench warrant. Yonko requests the Court hold off the warrant until Friday. Court: grants requests for bench warrant and will sign upon presentation.
Plea hearing on March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

3:20  PM 
Defendant William Kendall Adams in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Liesl Nelson by phone .  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def missed status conference.  Atty Nelson responds.  State asks for bond to be reinstated.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

10:10 Attorney Richard L. Yonko in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie requests a bench warrant based on Def's non appearance. Mr Yonko: doesn't know where the Def is. Court: orders bench warrant and will sign upon presentation. Thorie will submit warrant on Wednesday.
Status conference on September 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.

11:04  am 
Defendant William Kendall Adams in court with attorney Richard L Yonko.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Yonko is asking for testing of needle and blood in syringe.  Thorie responds.  It has been sent for testing and DA has a report, but it is incomplete and DNA Buccal swabs are necessary now.  Thorie is asking for an order for Buccal swab from his client.  Def agrees with order for Buccal swab testing.  Def to go to PCJ today and do DNA testing.
for Testing by the State Crime Laboratory filed by Richard Yonko
Motion hearing on June 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
filed by Wm Thorie
filed by Richard Yonko
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.

TWO Informations are filed with the Court and a copy is given to BOTH defendants and their attorneys.  Schwab will file a substitution of judge.  Court read charges on both files.  Yonko waives further reading of the Information and his client, Mr. Adams enters NOT GUILTY PLEAS.   Schwab waives further reading and his client, CRYSTAL GUAJARDO enters NOT GUILTY PLEAS.

11:02 am  AND 14CF60 CRYSTAL GUAJARDO APPEARS WITH ATTY DON SCHWAB
Defendant William Kendall Adams in court with attorney Richard L Yonko.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Mitchell Rhiel sworn and examined by William Thorie.  Witness IDs Crystal Guajarda.  Witness IDs William Adams.  Atty Yonko x-exams Deputy Rhiel.  Atty Schwab x-exams Deputy Rhiel.  No further evidence by any party.  Thorie makes argument.  Yonko makes argument.  Evidence seized was not his client's.  Schwab has no argument.  Court reads case law and addresses the totality of the circumstances.    The court finds probable cause and binds BOTH defendants over for further proceedings.  Court reviews standard conditions of bond with Mr. Adams.  Court reviews standard conditions of bond with Ms Guajardo.  Atty Yonko to see JA for new date.
Richard Yonko
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.

3:22 Defendant William Kendall Adams in court, in custody via video conferencing.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone with Def.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court read charges and penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. THorie requests $3000 signature bond. No objection by Atty Nelson. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Def has not been in any branch of the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.
